catalog_info.title: English Legal History, 600-1600
catalog_info.notes: Offered concurrently at the Law School as Law 42200A-1.
catalog_info.description: An introduction to the legal and constitutional history of England from the Anglo Saxons to the end of the Tudor period, essentially 600 – 1600, including the development of private (e.g., contract, torts, property) and public law (e.g., criminal and constitutional law).  No previous background in English legal history is assumed.
